description: TPO 196 T1 1 x Oak crown lift 8m from ground level.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak tree is located in the front garden of Balmoral, Northgate, Northwood. It is a mature specimen in good condition and forms a prominent feature within the streetscape of Northgate. The tree is clearly visible from multiple public vantage points, including neighbouring properties, the footpath, and the road, contributing significantly to the character of the area.

Given its size, condition, and visibility, the tree holds a high amenity value and plays an important role in maintaining the arboreal character of the local environment. Its contribution to the visual landscape remains unchanged since the previous application.
This application has been refused as the proposed works are still considered too severe and would result in a significant negative impact on the tree's visual amenity.
Although the request for a crown reduction has been omitted, the remaining proposed works - particularly the extent of crown lifting - would still result in a disproportionate alteration to the
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
